skill.name: expo-build-deploy
skill.description: Building and deploying Expo React Native apps to iOS. Use when configuring EAS Build, submitting to TestFlight, App Store deployment, managing certificates, or troubleshooting build issues.
skill.summary: Building and deploying Expo React Native apps to iOS. Use when configuring EAS Build, submitting to ...
skill.author: CJHarmath

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing pure markdown guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond reading the markdown file itself.

content.user_title: Build and deploy Expo iOS apps
content.value_statement: Expo iOS builds require complex configuration of EAS Build, certificates, and TestFlight. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for configuring builds, submitting to TestFlight, and troubleshooting common issues.
actual_capabilities: Configure EAS Build profiles in eas.json for development, preview, and production
Set up iOS credentials and certificates for App Store deployment
Submit builds to TestFlight using eas submit command
Manage environment variables and secrets for different build profiles
Deploy over-the-air updates without native code changes
Troubleshoot common build failures and signing issues
limitations: Does not execute builds or submit apps - provides command guidance only
Requires eas-cli to be installed separately
Does not modify app.json or eas.json files automatically
Apple Developer account required for iOS deployment

use_cases.title: Configure iOS builds
use_cases.description: Set up EAS Build with correct profiles for simulator, development, and production builds.

use_cases.title: Automate TestFlight deployment
use_cases.description: Create automated pipelines for submitting builds to TestFlight and App Store Connect.

use_cases.title: Deploy to App Store
use_cases.description: Navigate certificate management, export compliance, and submission requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Initial Setup
prompt_templates.scenario: Setting up EAS for first time
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I set up EAS Build for my Expo iOS app? Show me the commands to install eas-cli, log in, and configure eas.json.

prompt_templates.title: Build Types
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the difference between development, preview, and production build profiles in Expo? When should I use each?

prompt_templates.title: TestFlight
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I submit my Expo iOS build to TestFlight? Show me the commands and required configuration in eas.json.

prompt_templates.title: Troubleshooting
prompt_templates.prompt: My iOS build is failing with a signing error. How do I fix credential issues and reset my certificates for EAS Build?

output_examples.input: How do I build and submit my Expo app to TestFlight?
output: Install EAS CLI: npm install -g eas-cli
Build and submit: eas build --profile production --platform ios --auto-submit
Or submit existing build: eas submit --platform ios --latest

best_practices: Use eas credentials to let EAS manage certificates automatically when possible
Increment buildNumber for each upload to avoid duplicate build errors
Test with development profile on simulator before building for TestFlight
anti_patterns: Using the same buildNumber multiple times causes upload rejections
Skipping export compliance questions results in App Store rejection
Manually managing certificates when EAS can handle them automatically

faq.question: Is eas-cli installed with this skill?
faq.answer: No. You must install eas-cli separately using npm install -g eas-cli before running any build commands.

faq.question: What Apple account do I need?
faq.answer: An Apple Developer Program account is required for iOS builds and TestFlight submission.

faq.question: Can I build offline?
faq.answer: Yes, use eas build --platform ios --local to build on your machine with Xcode installed.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my project files?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides documentation and commands only. You must manually update eas.json and app.json.

faq.question: Why is my build stuck in processing?
faq.answer: TestFlight processing typically takes 10-30 minutes. Check App Store Connect status and ensure your buildNumber is unique.

faq.question: How is this different from expo build?
faq.answer: EAS Build is the modern replacement for the deprecated expo build service. Use eas-cli commands instead.
